definition: variant of 補丁|补丁[bu3 ding5]
to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement
to join things together by fixing them in place at one or more points/to nail/to pin/to staple/to sew on
nail/to follow closely/to keep at sb (to do sth)/variant of 盯[ding1]

sentences.english: The mend in your dress scarcely shows.
sentences.chinese: 你外套上的补钉简直看不出来。

sentences.english: We also use this period of scheduled downtime to apply patches.
sentences.chinese: 我们并且使用这个预定的停工期的期间应用补钉。

sentences.english: He wears a jacket of sorts with patches at the elbows.
sentences.chinese: 他穿了一件肘部打着各种补钉的茄克衫。

sentences.english: The coat with many patches is his.
sentences.chinese: 那件有很多补钉的上衣是他的。

sentences.english: The child's jeans had a patch at the knee.
sentences.chinese: 这孩子的裤子在膝盖处有一块补钉。

sentences.english: I sewed a patch over the hole in my jeans .
sentences.chinese: 我给我工装裤上的洞打了个补钉。

sentences.english: The mends on your coat were almost invisible.
sentences.chinese: 你外套上的补钉简直看不出来。

sentences.english: His overcoat had been worn for years, and was already mended in quite a few places.
sentences.chinese: 他的大衣穿了多年，已经打了不少补钉。

sentences.english: TXT file inside that patch download.
sentences.chinese: 在那补钉内的TXT文件下载。

definition: patch (for mending clothes, tires etc)/(software) patch
everyday robe worn at home in ancient times/robe worn by priests, monks and scholars
